p: Calcofluor white (CFW) at a concentration of 0.01 μg/mL was used as a chitin specific dye [ 35] to highlight the gross morphology and chitin distribution in CNB oil treated RSY150 along with blood and genital clinical isolates. Cell suspensions at two growth phases each, mid logarithmic (1 × 10 7 cells/mL) and stationary (2.2 × 10 5 cells/mL), were treated with MIC and 1/2 MIC of CNB oil and imaged on an Axio Observer Z1 inverted epifluorescence microscope (Oberkochen, Germany) at 63× magnification (λ ex = 365 nm; λ em = 435 nm).
